message.content: cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. The paper discusses the use of deep learning architectures for document and snippet retrieval tasks, which are commonly studied in the fields of natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are the most likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of novel extensions to deep learning architectures, which suggests a focus on machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely as well. Finally, the paper specifically mentions the effectiveness of deep learning for these tasks, indicating a focus on deep learning methods, making cs.DL (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category.
